author: Special Correspondent
text:
A controversy has erupted over the role of Bollywood actors Akshay Kumar and Kangana Ranaut in the International Fleet Review (IFR) under way in Visakhapatnam.

The two actors took part in the opening ceremony of the IFR at the INS Sathavahana Stadium on Friday. The Navy, in a statement issued after the ceremony, said: “The highlight of the event was the presence of Bollywood stars Akshay Kumar and Kangana Ranaut, the Brand Ambassadors of IFR, at the event.”

However, this was contradicted by Defence Minister Manohar Parrikar on Sunday who said the actors were guests. “Brand ambassadors have to sell a brand right from the beginning. I don’t think that there is any selling by these two [Akshay Kumar and Kangana],” Mr. Parrikar said in response to questions from reporters.

He added that they were definitely invited ... “but there is no contract and nothing has been paid to them.”

Subsequently, Navy officials clarified that the actors were not ambassadors and were only invited as guests.

The incident comes close on the heels of a controversy over the “dilution” of Beating Retreat ceremony in New Delhi.
title: ‘Akshay, Kangana are not brand ambassadors’
